title: eff-bot's Daily Python URL
desc: - Contains links to assorted resources from the Python universe, compiled by PythonWare.

title: O'Reilly Python Center
desc: - Features Python books, resources, news and articles.

title: Python Developer's Guide
desc: - Resources for reporting bugs, accessing the Python source tree with CVS and taking part in the development of Python.

title: Altis, Kevin
desc: - News and information related to Python and its promotion as "most powerful language you can still read."

title: Anand Pillai -  Random bytes on technology and open source
Blended Technologies
desc: - Programming weblog for a small, newly formed, and curious company; covers mostly Python.

title: Gruet, Richard
desc: - Python Language Quick Reference versions 1.5 to 2.3. OmniORBpy utilities and other Python stuff.

title: Hinsen, Konrad
desc: - Python for science. In particular computational chemistry.

title: Kuchling, A.M.
desc: - Lots of Python code and information, several quotation collections, and a Robertson Davies page.

title: Learning Python
desc: - A weblog tracking one man's journey into Python.

title: Social Bug
desc: - Scripts, examples and news about Python programming for the Windows platform.

title: Lundh, Fredrik
desc: - Personal guide to libraries, modules and extensions. Includes a weblog with Python news and personal ramblings.

title: Norlanders, Oscar
desc: - Blog about programming. TeX bibliography tweak. Resume. Links.

title: van Rossum, Guido
desc: - Personal home page of the creator of the Python programming language.

title: BayPIGgies
desc: - The Silicon Valley-San Francisco Bay Area Python Users Group.

title: Chicago Python User Group
desc: - Meetings, book reviews and mailing list.

title: Clepy
desc: - A group of Python enthusiasts living in the Cleveland, Ohio, area.

title: Dallas Ft. Worth Pythoneers
desc: - Offers mailing list, a source repository and member profiles.

title: Fredericksburg ZPUG
desc: - Fredericksburg Zope and Python Users Group.

title: FRPythoneers
desc: - A Python user group in the Fort Collins area that meets in Broomfield, CO.

title: The GrimPypers
desc: - A group of Python users, programmers and enthusiasts based in Grimstad, Norway.

title: Computers: Programming: FAQs, Help, and Tutorials
Computers: Programming: Languages: Python: Articles and Reviews
Omaha Python Users Group
desc: - A Python users group in the Omaha, NE Metro area.

title: OPAG
desc: - Ottawa Python Authors Group. A group devoted to learning, using and providing resources for Python. OPAG also serves as a general gathering place for Python programmers from the Ottawa region and beyond.

title: PyGTA
desc: - The Toronto Python/Zope User Group meets regularly to explore the expanding world of Python and Zope.

title: TriZPUG
desc: - he Triangle Zope/Python User Group in the Raleigh-Durham-Chapel Hill area of North Carolina, USA.

title: Utah Python User Group
desc: - Offers meeting information, mailing list and links to members' blogs.

title: Python Documentation Index
desc: - Official tutorial and references, including library/module usage, Macintosh libraries, language syntax, extending/embedding, and the Python/C API. Also links to off-site beginners' tutorials, HOWTOs, and many special interest topics.

title: About.com: Python
desc: - Includes articles on simple script solutions, database management, web development, network protocols, and other advanced topics.

title: A Beginner's Python Tutorial
desc: - A Python tutorial originally written for the modding community of Firaxis' Civilization. Useful to beginners with little or no programming knowledge.

title: Cameron Laird on Python and the Web
desc: - Discusses both client-side and server-side Web programming.

title: Code Like a Pythonista: Idiomatic Python
desc: - A tutorial that teaches common Python programming idioms used by experienced programmers, but may not be obvious to newcomers.

title: A Course in Python/CGI
desc: - This site contains materials from a 13 week course for learning Python and CGI. Suited for self-study.

title: The Django Book
desc: - Free (Only E-Book version) Django Web Framework E-Book by APress. The best book for learning Django. Requires good understanding of Python.

title: Five Minutes to a Python CGI
desc: - By David Mertz. Brief introduction to writing CGI programs, Python CGI module, formatting output, error logging/debugging.

title: Instant Hacking
desc: - By Magnus Lie Hetland. Minimal, concise, general introduction to programming, via Python, moves very quickly. English, Italian, Polish, Japanese, Serbian, Korean.

title: Instant Python
desc: - By Magnus Lie Hetland. Minimal introduction for experienced programmers. Treats basics, OO programming, Jedi mind trick. English, French, Italian, Portuguese, Spanish; German, Norwegian; Lithuanian, Polish, Russian; Japanese, Korean.

title: One Day of IDLE Toying
desc: - By Danny Yoo. Visual guide to using IDLE, a simple interactive shell for Python programming. Each step of this tutorial has screenshots for absolute beginners. English, Dutch, German; Greek, French, Italian, Portuguese; Indonesian.

title: Python and UML
desc: - Can the UML help Python developers? How about CP4E?

title: Python Database Programming
desc: - Programs can use minimal code to access, display, and update a database. This guide provides "links to relevant Python modules, documentation, and projects" concerning databases, as well as adding persistence to Python objects.

title: Python for Beginners
desc: - New to programming? This page lists some places that can get you started quickly.

title: Python Programming for Beginners
desc: - Shows how to write programs that use command-line options, read and write to pipes, access environment variables, handle interrupts, read from and write to files, create temporary files, write to system logs.

title: Python Programming Tutorial
desc: - By Richard G. Baldwin. Separate lessons teach programming basics. Free online, fee download files.

title: Python Quick Reference
desc: - By Simon Brunning. Thorough 'cheat sheet'; brief reminders for nearly each language aspect: syntax nuances; built-in features, statements, modules; basic, advanced types, operations; lexical entities, common development tools. For several Python versions; HTML, Zip, Windows Help, text.

title: Python Recipes
desc: - Collaborative website built by ActiveState and O'Reilly, hosts user contributions; collection of recipes.

title: Python SIGs
desc: - Archives of current and past listserv discussions on a LOT of interesting topics. GREAT for researching problems.

title: Python Tutorial
desc: - Introduction to Python, where to find it, how to install, and create a very simple script.

title: A Quick Tour of Python
desc: - Short overview of some basics, for users with some programming knowledge.

title: TCC Publications: Programming Languages
desc: - Python language quick reference (28 pp),  Tkinter reference (84 pp),  Python Imaging Library PIL quick reference (6 pp). Postscript and PDF formats available.

title: Tutorialized.com - Free Python tutorials
desc: - A collection of Python tutorials from resources around the Internet.

title: Wikibooks Programming Python
desc: - A tutorial for python on Wikibooks. It is editable by anyone.

title: Writing CGI Programs in Python
desc: - Introduces using Python for CGI applications. Has database access examples. Several parts. [Developer Shed]

title: 1% the Code
desc: - Chuck Moore, father of Forth, says programs can be far smaller in colorForth than C. No code samples.

title: 99 Bottles of Beer on the Wall
desc: - Shows source code implementation for the same simple program across over 250 different programming languages.

title: Accumulator Generator
desc: - Compares canonical solutions to same problem as code samples in: C++, Dylan, E, Erlang, Haskell, JavaScript, Lisp (Arc, Common, Goo, Scheme), Lua, Maple, Mathematica, Oz-Mozart, NewtonScript, Perl, Python, REBOL, Ruby, Smalltalk, VBScript. [Paul Graham]

title: Ada 95, Java, and C++
desc: - Some think Java is like C++. Usual C++ idioms do not apply to Java as it is not a C++ superset or subset; Java is a derivation with many modifications, extensions. Both language syntax are alike, but semantics and philosophy are very different. Java is nearer Ada 95 than C++, except in syntax.

title: Ada, C, C++, and Java vs. The Steelman
desc: - Compares 4 programming languages (Ada 95, C, C++, Java) with the needs of "Steelman", original 1978 requirements document for Ada language. Big detailed table.

title: The BNF Web Club Language
desc: - Browse, explore some programming language syntax rules, see relations between rules, understand them via BNF (Backus-Naur Form notation) and syntactic diagrams: SQL, PL/SQL, SQL2, IDL; Ada 95, Java, Modula-2; Lazy, Lisp, M5.

title: The Case against C
desc: - Five short essays compare C (and C++ by extension) to Fortran: Why C is Not a Good Numerical Language, Why C is Not a Good First Language, C's Poor Loop Constructs, C's Pointers and Optimisation, Optimisation through Directives.

title: CLOS, Eiffel, and Sather: A Comparison
desc: - References, zipped Postscript, and inlined gifs.

title: A Comparative Overview of C#
desc: - Also compares C#, Java, C++. By Ben Albahari.

title: Comparisons of Tcl with Other Systems
desc: - Many comparisons between Tcl/Tk and other similar systems, most copied from comp.lang.tcl.

title: The Computer Language Benchmarks Game
desc: - Performance measurements and source code for multiple benchmark programs in different languages; with side-by-side comparisons between any two programming language implementations, and interactive boxplot chart comparisons between any 15.

title: D vs Other Languages
desc: - Yes-No table with definitions compares D, C, C++, C#, Java, on: GC, functions, arrays, OOP, performance, reliability, compatibility, conditional compiling. [Digital Mars]

title: Eiffel and Delphi Compared
desc: - Text compares differences of several main aspects.

title: An Empirical Comparison of C, C++, Java, Perl, Python, Rexx, and Tcl for a Search/string-processing Program
desc:
- One set of requirements, 80 implementations, coded by 74 different programmers in various languages, compared for properties: run time, memory use, source text length, comment density, program structure, reliability, effort needed.
                                 [PDF]

title: Forth and Not C
desc: - Pro-Forth text explains why C is used more than Forth.

title: Forth Versus C
desc: - Pro-Forth question and answer text, some questions have several answers.

title: Four-fold Increase in Productivity and Quality
desc:
- Published internal study, of Ericsson AXD 301 ATM switch project, using Erlang, C, C++, Java. Results: programmer productivity, code error rates, roughly proportional to source code size.
                                 [PDF]

title: Guidelines for Choosing a Computer Language: Support for the Visionary Organizations
desc: - Multipage study compares: 4GL/5GL, 3GL (Ada 95, C, C++, COBOL, FORTRAN, Java, Smalltalk), 2GL (Assembly). Divides language (definition) from traits of products that implement and support it. Several sections, tables, appendixes.

title: History and Comparison of Programming Languages
desc: - Files compare statements in several different languages, tracing from early to present languages.

title: Java and C++ Resource Management Comparison
desc:
- Detailed discussion of the techniques used in Java and C++ to implement leak free and exception safe resource management. Covers memory management, finalizers, destructors and finally blocks with examples.
                                 [PDF]

title: Languages Versus D
desc: - Growing table compares D, C, C++, C#, Java, Delphi, Python, Perl, Eiffel, Sather, Smalltalk, Lisp/CLOS, Ada. Many clarifying comments below. [Wiki4D, Open Content]

title: Lisp as an Alternative to Java
desc: - Brief text on comparisons of C, C++, Java, Lisp, Ron Garret / Erann Gat study, with conforming example program Lisp source code; very useful links.

title: Lisp as an Alternative to Java
desc:
- Ron Garret / Erann Gat comparison, starts from 1999 Prechelt study results, adds many insights; as text, a few tables. [Intelligence]
                                 [PDF]

title: Multi-Core Ant Colony Optimization for TSP in Erlang
desc: - Compares Erlang, GHC Haskell, Standard ML (Alice, MLton); text, tables, graphs.

title: Nine Language Performance Round-up: Benchmarking Math & File I/O
desc: - Small-scale benchmark test run on 9 languages or variants: Java 1.3.1 and 1.4.2, C via gcc 3.3.1, Python 2.3.2 and via Psyco 1.1.1, 4 from Microsoft Visual Studio .NET 2003: Visual Basic/C#/C++/J#.

title: Perl vs. Python vs. Ruby
desc: - Comparison with text, code samples, many reader comments. Michael Tsai weblog.

title: PLEAC: Programming Language Examples Alike Cookbook
desc: - Suite of common programming problems solved in Ada, C++, Erlang, Guile, Haskell, Java, Masd, merd, NASM, Objective Caml, Perl, Pliant, Python, Ruby, Tcl.

title: Programming Information from HB
desc: - Text descriptions compare C/C++, Java, Pascal, Basic, VeraStream; Oracle; HTML, XML; JavaScript, PHP.

title: Programming Language Benchmarks
desc: - Compares the same program in Ada, C, Forth, FORTRAN, Java, Lisp, Perl, R, Ruby. Goal: support decisions in language choice for making compute-intensive Web programs. Text, table, code samples.

title: Programming Language Comparison
desc: - Table and text compares many features of some popular object-oriented languages: C++, C#, Eiffel, Java, Perl, Python, Ruby, Smalltalk, Visual Basic.

title: Programming Languages Mini-howto
desc: - Briefly compares major Linux programming languages: C, C++, Fortran, Java, Lisp, Perl, PHP, Python, Tcl; by Risto S. Varanka.

title: Programming Languages Study
desc: - Includes: diagram, history of languages; history of language concepts; syntax across languages; Scriptometer measures scripting ease of languages; mutability and sharing of various values in various languages.

title: Python Compared to Other Languages
desc: - Many links to comparisons involving Python.

title: Qtime Collection, FTP Download, Gzipped
desc: - Display time as English sentence, coded in: AWK, C, ICI, Icon, JavaScript, Lite/mSQL, PHP3, Pike, Python, REBOL, Rexx, Ruby, SLang, Spanner. Tested on only Linux (all) and AmigaOS (C and Rexx versions).

title: The Quine Page
desc: - Collection of self-reproducing programs: each outputs a copy of its own source code; about 60 languages.

title: Ray Tracer Language Comparison
desc: - Mini ray tracer benchmark written equivalently in C++, Java, SML, Objective Caml, Lisp, Scheme. Compares verbosity, performance; text, code samples, tables, image, graph. [Flying Frog Consultancy]

title: Reasons for TOM
desc: - TOM attempts to address flaws in these languages: C++, Cecil, Common Lisp, Eiffel, Java, Objective-C, Smalltalk.

title: Simple Programs in Various Different Programming Languages
desc: - Common algorithms and other sample code in the languages: Bash and Bourne shells, C/C++, Java, MATLAB/Octave, Perl, Python, Ruby, Scheme.

title: Syntax Across Languages
desc: - Operator names and syntax elements in various programming languages.

title: Team Eiffel: The Zen of Python, Part I
desc: - Text compares Python and Eiffel, via Tim Peters' Zen rules.

title: TIOBE Programming Community Index: TPCI
desc: - Updated monthly. Shows language popularity via world-wide availability of skilled engineers, courses, 3rd party vendors. Calculated from search engines Google, MSN, Yahoo.

title: TMXxine Languages
desc: - Brief comparison Curl with High Level assembler, BCX, Dark Basic, Mono (C#/.Net implementation), Python, Squeak, XBasic/XBlite. Curl applet examples.

title: University of Michigan's Language Guide
desc: - Each entry includes history, description, code examples, and references.

title: What Languages Fix
desc: - Compares many languages in brief text, describes each by the problem it fixes. [Paul Graham]

title: What's Wrong with Perl
desc: - Author explains what he considers wrong about Perl, presents Python as an alternative. Descriptions, code samples, links.

title: Why Pascal is Not My Favorite Programming Language
desc: - Brian Kernighan's comparison of Pascal and C

title: Why to Move from ASM to C
desc: - Brief text compares Assembly to C; lower to higher level language. ScienceProg.

title: Comparing PHP with Other Languages
desc:
- Text compares several traits of ASP.NET, C#, PHP, Java, Lisp, Perl, Python, Ruby, Smalltalk. Article with forum posts. [Professional PHP]
                                 (February 09, 2006)

title: Schizoid Classes: Of Class, Type, and Method
desc:
- Compares Java and Smalltalk, in text and table. By Rodney Bates. [ACM Queue]
                                 (September 01, 2004)

title: What I Hate About Your Programming Language
desc:
- Text treats general aspects of language choices, then compares hatred of Perl, Python, Ruby, PHP, Java, C, C++, JavaScript, XSLT, SQL. With many forum comments. [ONLamp.com]
                                 (May 12, 2003)

title: Are Scripting Languages the Wave of the Future?
desc:
- Programming guru, Robert Martin, on languages of the coming decade. [ITworld.com]
                                 (March 01, 2001)

title: C#: A Language Alternative or Just J--?, Part 1
desc:
- Compares C# to Java, describes features and design trade-offs, places C# in context of broader Microsoft .Net strategy. Text, tables, code samples, links. By Mark Johnson. First article of 2-part series. [JavaWorld]
                                 (November 01, 2000)

title: C# Strikes a Chord
desc:
- Compares 4 languages: C, C++, C#, Java. Shows family genealogy. [Dr. Dobb's Journal]
                                 (September 04, 2000)

title: The C Family of Languages
desc:
- Interview with Dennis Ritchie, Bjarne Stroustrup, James Gosling.
                                 (July 01, 2000)

title: An Empirical Comparison of C, C++, Java, Perl, Python, Rexx, and Tcl
desc:
- By Lutz Prechelt. Neutral, quantitative analysis of 7 languages in title, for 7 variables, via 80 implementations of the same requirement set. PDF format. [IEEE Computer]
                                 [PDF] (March 14, 2000)

title: Charming Python
desc: - Column by David Mertz, Gnosis Software, Inc. Over 20 articles on Python programming, many topics.

title: Developing GNOME Application with Python
desc: - Set of articles written for beginners in Gnome programming and GNU/Linux.

title: An Interview with Guido van Rossum
desc: - Python creator discusses features and future of the language. O'Reilly Media.

title: Mark Lutz's Python Advocacy Page
desc: - Links to several old Python articles and reviews.

title: Python Enhancement Proposals (PEPs)
desc: - Design documents providing information to the Python community, or describing a new feature for Python.

title: Python Programming Language
desc: - Growing article, with links to many related topics. [Wikipedia]

title: Python Squeezes the Web
desc: - A practical example of using Python to automate the crawl of web pages.

title: SOA and Web Services
desc: - Several articles related to the development of web services with Python, written by Mike Olson and Uche Ogbuji, 2001-2004. IBM developerWorks.

title: Interview of Guido van Rossum
desc:
- Interview of the BDFL by the visitors of a French Linux news portal (the English version is included).
                                 (March 12, 2003)

title: A Conversation with Guido van Rossum
desc:
- Python creator talks with Bill Venners about topics relevant to Python and its community; 6 part series, Artima Software.
                                 (February 17, 2003)

title: Proper XML Output in Python
desc:
- Uche Ogbuji explores the intricacies of creating proper XML output in Python, including character set and encoding issues.
                                 (November 13, 2002)

title: Python Persistence Management
desc:
- Using serialization to store Python objects.
                                 (November 01, 2002)

title: A Tour of 4Suite
desc:
- In this installment of Python and XML, Uche Ogbuji provides a tour of the core XML processing facilities of 4Suite.
                                 (October 16, 2002)

title: Make Python Run as Fast as C with Psyco
desc:
- Using psyco, the python specializing compiler.
                                 (October 01, 2002)

title: Simplified Exception Identification in Python
desc:
- Using functions and exception pattern dictionaries to simplify error recovery.
                                 (July 28, 2002)

title: Pick Up Some Python with This Script Walk-through
desc:
- An example conversion of a Perl script to Python.
                                 (June 18, 2002)

title: Space Shuttle Engineers Use Python to Streamline Mission Design
desc:
- Description of a practical use of Python by NASA, with quotes of Robin Friedrich, USA's Senior Project Engineer.
                                 (June 17, 2002)

title: Python: Yes, You Should Be Using It!
desc:
- Alex Martelli gives an overview of the possibilities offered by Python, along with samples allowing the newcomer to experience Python code. [Free registration required to view this article.]
                                 (April 01, 2002)

title: Using Mix-ins with Python
desc:
- An explanation of the mix-in programming style as applied in Python.
                                 (April 01, 2001)

title: Embedding Python in Multi-Threaded C/C++ Applications
desc:
- A Linux Magazine article featuring an overview of the C/C++ API, explaining how to extend and embed Python in a multi-thread context.
                                 (May 01, 2000)

title: Why Python?
desc:
- Article by Eric Raymond where he explains reasons that led him to switch from Perl to Python.
                                 (May 01, 2000)

title: Linux Journal Python Interview
desc:
- An Interview with Guido van Rossum. A conversation with the creator of Python about an effort to teach Python to non-computer science students.
                                 (September 28, 1999)

title: bridgekeeper
desc: - A Perl to Python source code conversion service.

title: decompyle
desc: - A service to decompile Python bytecode to readable Python source files.

title: Pythonware
desc: - Developers of the PythonWorks IDE,  and useful modules such as the Python Imaging Library and  XML-RPC implementation.

title: ReportLab
desc: - Authors of PDFgen, for generating professionally formatted printable documents on the fly.

title: Xellsoft
desc: - Specialize in Python programming technology and object oriented databases, develop custom software and offer consulting in the area of internet, data communication, technical and scientific programming.

title: Hap Python Remote Debugger
desc: - A remote debugger and IDE that can also be used for local debugging.

title: IPython
desc: - An enhanced interactive Python shell with many features for object introspection, system shell access, and its own special command system for adding functionality when working interactively. [Open Source, LGPL]

title: PyCrust - The Flakiest Python Shell
desc: - An interactive, graphical Python shell written in Python using wxPython.

title: Pymerase
desc: - A tool intended to generate a python object model, relational database, and an object-relational model connecting the two using UML or XML. However, it has been extended to also output GUI widgets and can be easily extended to output whatever else you might like. [Open source, MIT License]

title: PyReverse
desc: - A set of tools for reverse engineering Python code, including creation of files readable by ArgoUML. Project information, downloads, and bug-track details. [Open Source, GPL]

title: Tixapps Applications Framework
desc: - Tixapps applications are a suite of development applications that run with  Tk/Tcl or Python, using the Tix widget set. [Open Source, BSD-like]

title: Winpdb
desc: - An advanced python debugger, with support for smart breakpoints, multiple threads, namespace modification, embedded debugging and encrypted communication.

title: config
desc: - Module allows implement a hierarchical configuration scheme for Python applications.

title: ExpectPy
desc: - An extension for a Python-feel to the Expect library. [Open Source, LGPL]

title: Grouch
desc: - Web development related open source software packages developed by MEMS and Nanotechnology Exchange. [Open Source, Python license]

title: log4p
desc: - The Logging Toolkit For Python, modeled after the Java toolkit log4j. [Open Source, IBM Public License]

title: mxBase package extensions for Python
desc: - The eGenix.com mx Extensions for Python are a collection of professional quality Python software tools which enhance Python's usability in many important areas such as ODBC database connectivity, fast text processing, date/time processing and web site programming.

title: Core Python Programming
desc: - By Wesley J. Chun; Prentice Hall PTR, 2001, ISBN 0130260363. For experienced developers to improve extant skills; professional level examples. Starts by introducing syntax, objects, error handling, functions, classes, built-ins. [Prentice Hall]

title: Data Structures and Algorithms with Object-Oriented Design Patterns in Python
desc:
- The primary goal of this book is to promote object-oriented design using Python and to illustrate the use of the emerging object-oriented design patterns.
A secondary goal of the book is to present mathematical tools just in time. Analysis techniques and proofs are presented as needed and in the proper context.

title: Dive Into Python 3
desc: - By Mark Pilgrim, Guide to Python 3  and its differences from Python 2. Each chapter starts with a real code sample and explains it fully. Has a comprehensive appendix of all the syntactic and semantic changes in Python 3

title: Foundations of Python Network Programming
desc: - This book covers a wide range of topics. From raw TCP and UDP to encryption with TSL, and then to HTTP, SMTP, POP, IMAP, and ssh. It gives you a good understanding of each field and how to do everything on the network with Python.

title: FreeTechBooks: Python Scripting Language
desc: - Annotated list of free online books on Python scripting language. Topics range from beginner to advanced.

title: How to Think Like a Computer Scientist: Learning with Python
desc: - By Allen B. Downey, Jeffrey Elkner, Chris Meyers; Green Tea Press, 2002, ISBN 0971677506. Teaches general principles of programming, via Python as subject language. Thorough, in-depth approach to many basic and intermediate programming topics. Full text online and downloads: HTML, PDF, PS, LaTeX. [Free, Green Tea Press]

title: An Introduction to Python
desc: - By Guido van Rossum, Fred L. Drake, Jr.; Network Theory Ltd., 2003, ISBN 0954161769. Printed edition of official tutorial, for v2.x, from Python.org. [Network Theory, online]

title: Learn to Program Using Python
desc: - Book by Alan Gauld with full text online. Introduction for those learning programming basics: terminology, concepts, methods to write code. Assumes no prior knowledge but basic computer skills.

title: Making Use of Python
desc: - By Rashi Gupta; John Wiley and Sons, 2002, ISBN 0471219754. Covers language basics, use for CGI scripting, GUI development, network programming; shows why it is one of more sophisticated of popular scripting languages. [Wiley]

title: Practical Python
desc: - By Magnus Lie Hetland; Apress LP, 2002, ISBN 1590590066. Readable guide to ideas most vital to new users, from basics common to high level languages, to more specific aspects, to a series of 10 ever more complex programs. [Apress]

title: Pro Python System Administration
desc: - By Rytis Sileika, ISBN13: 978-1-4302-2605-5, Uses real-world system administration examples like manage devices with SNMP and SOAP, build a distributed monitoring system, manage web applications and parse complex log files, monitor and manage MySQL databases.

title: Programming in Python 3 (Second Edition)
desc: - A Complete Introduction to the Python 3.

title: Orange
desc: - A free, component-based, public domain data mining software, which includes a range of preprocessing, modelling and data exploration techniques. [Open Source, GPL]

title: Parallel Python
desc: - Provides an open source module to allow parallel execution of code on systems with multiple processors and on clusters. Features list, documentation, download, code samples, and a discussion forum.

title: Sisyphus
desc: - A module that simplifies running Python stuff as cron jobs. [Open Source, Python license]

title: The Snack Sound Toolkit
desc: - Module for basic sound handling (sound card and disk I/O); includes primitives for sound visualization, e.g. waveforms and spectrograms. [Open Source, GPL]

title: txObject ATK
desc: - Contains the following parts: Object Library, IO/Timers, Threads, Inter-Process/Distributed Communication. [Open Source, GPL]

title: CPython
desc: - The original implementation of Python, written in C.

title: IronPython
desc: - A fast Python implementation for .NET and Mono.

title: Jython
desc: - A 100 % Pure Java implementation of the Python language.

title: Python for .NET
desc: - Package gives nearly seamless integration with .NET Common Language Runtime: CLR. Strong scripting tool, allows scripting or building full programs in Python, using .NET services and components coded in any language targeting CLR: Managed C++, C#, VB, JScript.

title: Stackless Python
desc: - An experimental implementation that supports continuations, generators, microthreads, and coroutines.

title: Python 2.1 Bible
desc: - By Dave Brueck, Stephen Tanner; John Wiley and Sons, 2001, ISBN 0764548077. Full coverage, clear explanations, hands-on examples, full language reference; shows step by step how to use components, assemble them, form full-featured programs. [John Wiley and Sons]

title: Python 3 Object Oriented Programming
desc: - A step-by-step tutorial for OOP in Python 3, including discussion and examples of abstraction, encapsulation, information hiding, and raise, handle, define, and manipulate exceptions.

title: Python Language Reference Manual
desc: - By Guido van Rossum, Fred L. Drake, Jr.; Network Theory Ltd., 2003, ISBN 0954161785. Printed edition of official language reference, for v2.x, from Python.org, describes syntax, built-in datatypes. [Network Theory, online]

title: Python Programming Patterns
desc: - By Thomas W. Christopher; Prentice Hall PTR, 2002, ISBN 0130409561. Shows how to write large programs, introduces powerful design patterns that deliver high levels of robustness, scalability, reuse.

title: Python Programming with the Java Class Libraries: A Tutorial for Building Web and Enterprise Applications with Jython
desc: - By Richard Hightower; Addison-Wesley, 2002, 0201616165. Begins with Python basics, many exercises, interactive sessions. Shows programming novices concepts and practical methods. Shows programming experts Python's abilities and ways to interface with Java APIs. [publisher website]

title: Python: Visual QuickStart Guide
desc: - By Chris Fehily; Peachpit Press, 2002, ISBN 0201748843. Task-based, step-by-step visual reference guide, many screen shots, for courses in digital graphics; Web design, scripting, development; multimedia, page layout, office tools, operating systems. [Prentice Hall]

title: Sams Teach Yourself Python in 24 Hours
desc: - By Ivan Van Laningham; Sams Publishing, 2000, ISBN 0672317354. Split into 24 hands-on, 1 hour lessons; steps needed to learn topic: syntax, language features, OO design and programming, GUIs (Tkinter), system administration, CGI. [Sams Publishing]

title: Text Processing in Python
desc: - By David Mertz; Addison Wesley. Book in progress, full text, ASCII format. Asks for feedback. [author website, Gnosis Software, Inc.]

title: XML Processing with Python

desc: - Text eines Vortrages zur Vorstellung der Programmiersprache.

title: Python Academy UG (haftungsbeschränkt) & Co. KG
desc: - Das Unternehmen ist auf Pythonschulungen und damit verbundene Beratungsleistungen spezialisiert. Neben Seminaren für Programmieranfänger und Schulungen für Programmierer gibt es Module für Spezialthemen, die als Firmenkurse kombiniert werden können. Weiterhin sind Kurse für Wissenschaftler und Ingenieure im Programm. [D-04158 Leipzig]

title: Python Developer
desc: - Ein Weblog von Matthias Süß mit Code-Schnippseln aus den Themenbereichen Netzwerkprogrammierung und Textverarbeitung mit Python.

title: Python Netzwerk Deutschland
desc: - Eine Mailing-Liste, welche als Kontaktstelle dient zwischen  Firmen und IT-Spezialisten mit Python-Erfahrung.

title: Pythonmania
desc: - Im Blog werden Artikel, Tutorials, Links, Buchrezensionen und Neuigkeiten gesammelt.

title: Die Skriptsprache Python im Vergleich
desc: - Ein systematischer Vergleich von Python mit Perl und Tcl.

title: Computers: Programming: Languages: Comparison and Review
Computers: Programming: Languages: Garbage Collected: Object-Oriented
Ace Scripting Language
desc: - High-performance, strongly typed language, support for SGML and XML document standards, part of Structured Information Manager (SIM) product range. Free Download.

title: Blaise
desc: - An object-oriented scripting language with Object Pascal-like syntax. [Open source, MPL]

title: C-SMILE
desc: - Scripting language, syntax and structure from C, C++, Java, JavaScript. In classification, resides between Java and JavaScript. Has compiler, virtual machine running bytecodes, C/C++ extensible runtime. Runs standalone or embedded. [Public Domain]

title: Expect
desc: - Scripting language related to Tcl, for controlling interactive processes. [Public Domain]

title: Scriptol Compiler
desc: - Object- and XML-oriented, procedural language; goals: natural, safe, powerful, make programming fast and pleasant; code compiles to PHP or C++, source code or binary. English, Français. Open source, Mozilla license.

title: Scriptol Interpreter
desc: - Description, examples, FAQ, CD, resources, translations, links.  Open source, BSD license. [English, French]

title: Squirrel
desc: - A high level imperative/OO programming language, designed to be a scripting tool that fits in the size, memory bandwidth, and real-time requirements of applications like games. [Open source, zlib/libpng licence]

title: Nova
desc: - High-level, general purpose, pure object-oriented language; platform independent, strong-typed, garbage collected, very small Run-Time Environment (RTE) runs programs directly from source code, live code can be distributed-shared across networks as easily as HTML.

title: Object-Oriented Concurrent Reflective Languages can be Implemented Efficiently
Reflection in Logic, Functional and Object-Priented Programming: A Short Comparative Study
desc: - Research paper; Department of Data Processing and Operations Research, University of Montreal, Quebec, Canada. ResearchIndex.

title: Computers: Software: Operating Systems: Open Source
ActiveState Programmer Network: ASPN
desc: - Online resource for open source community: information and resources for Perl, PHP, Python, Tcl, XSLT; Cookbooks, documents, mail lists, modules, news feeds, products, user groups, Web services.

title: ELAN
desc: - Created 1974 by Technical University of Berlin group, as alternative to BASIC in teaching, for systematic programming, and related styles: top-down, bottom-up, recursive, modular, syntax-directed. Descriptions, brief resource list, documents. English, Deutsch.

title: Heron-Centric: Ruminations of a Language Designer
desc: - Weblog on language design issues, software development techniques, news, on Heron language, and similar languages like Java, C++.

title: Kx Systems, Inc.
desc: - Makes K, advanced vector oriented, functional language, one of the fastest application development environments (according to Bell Laboratories Benchmarking), and allows very fast processing of large datasets.

title: Lfyre
desc: - General purpose, compiled; high performance, expressiveness, flexibility. Many features found in other languages, and extra features: creating new operators, keywords, programming paradigms. News, download. [SourceForge]

title: Lightweight Languages as Software Engineering Tools
desc: - Usenix Paper discussing multiparadigm programming as part of a larger topic.

title: Multiparadigm Programming Language
desc: - Brief description, language list sorted by count and supported paradigms. [Wikipedia]

title: Needle
desc: - Pure object-oriented, functional language, statically typed, garbage collected; mixes ideas from Dylan, Lisp, Scheme; ML; Cecil, Smalltalk; description, slide show, downloads, links. [Open Source, MIT]

title: Nial Systems Ltd.
desc: - NIAL, Nested Interactive Array Language, mixes aspects of functional array and procedural languages. Rich primitives set makes it easy, fast to code loop-free data-driven algorithms. Also Q'Nial IDE, and Nial Data Engine embeddable interpreter. [Open Source, Artistic Licence]

title: An Object Model for Multiparadigm Programming
Piccola: A Small Composition Language
desc: - PI based COmposition LAnguage: research language to explore the paradigm: Application = Components + Scripts. From the University of Berne.

title: ResearchIndex: From Competition to Amalgamation of Different Programming Paradigms
desc: - Describes basic elements (data, actions, tunings, voids, mixtures, ...) and principles of programming (stratification, implicit knowledge, limited freedom, ...), directed to amalgamating different programming paradigms (imperative, object-oriented, functional, constraint, ...) in a unified process of generating computer system models.

title: Scala
desc: - General purpose language; multiparadigm (object-oriented, functional, concurrent elements); statically typed, type-safe; focus: Web services. Successor of Funnel. Interoperates with Java VM or .NET, XML aware. [Open source, BSD-like license]

title: X Language: xlang
desc: - The eXtensible Language: easy to use, multi-syntax, portable set of APIs to create CLI and GUI applications for Unix/X11 and Win32; will ease making big applications, has interpreter/compiler/debugger. [Open Source, GPL]

title: Computers: Programming: Languages: ML: Objective Caml
Bytecode
desc: - Growing article, with links to many related topics. [Wikipedia, open content, GNU FDL]

title: Parrotcode
desc: - Home of Parrot Virtual Machine, made for dynamic languages, originally a target for Perl 6 compiler, hosts many language implementations in varied stages of completion: Tcl, Javascript, Ruby, Lua, Scheme, PHP, Python, Perl 6, APL, .NET. Open source.

title: Virtual Virtual Machine
desc: - VVM overview, history, members, projects, realizations, publications.

title: XLR: Extensible Language and Runtime
desc: - XL is designed to implement the ideas of Concept Programming. It can apply to many domains and problem spaces, not only a small subset of the problems users must solve.

title: Heron: Introducing The Heron Programming Language
Computers: Programming: Languages: Comparison and Review
bx
desc: - Language with objects, interfaces, parameterized types, no inheritance, operator overloading, generators, static instantiation, compiled to C; descriptions, source code, examples, compiler.

title: Class (Computer Science)
desc: - Growing article, with links to many related topics. [Wikipedia]

title: CodeSimian
desc: - Interpreted, with 1 type (all is data) only, made with Java; can be used as strings of its own code or as Java objects, code (even 1-line program) can write or modify other code; main purpose: write artificial intelligences that modify (parts of) themselves or write other code.

title: Dynace
desc: - Object-oriented extension to C language. Solves many of the problems associated with C++.

title: JellyJ
desc: - Project to create object-oriented language that is easy to learn for beginners.

title: Lava
desc: - Experimental, innovative, object-oriented, interpreted language, and programming environment LavaPE; edits programs via syntax-sensitive point-and-click style structure editors, not text editors; parameterized (virtual) types, refactoring,  static checks.

title: merd
desc: - Ruby-like expressiveness + static type checks, like Haskell. [Open Source, GPL]

title: merd: SourceForge
desc: - Practical OO language: Ruby-like expressiveness with Haskell-like static type checks. Coded in ML, runs on Linux. [Open Source, GPL]

title: Nice
desc: - OO language based on, integrated with, Java (compiler emits Java bytecode); features of functional programming, implements state-of-art results from academic research, for more expressivity, modularity, safety. [Open source, GPL]

title: Noobeed
desc: - Interactive geomatic object-oriented language for spatial modeling, image processing, remote sensing, digital photogrammetry, geographic information system (GIS), geodesy, and surveying and mapping.

title: Nosica
desc: - Syntax similar to C++, Java, advanced high level features: strong type system, automatic memory management, global code optimization. Development website, has some documentation, forum, announcement from developers, sources. [Open source, GPL]

title: Qu
desc: - Full-featured, semi-dynamic object-oriented language. [Open source, GPL]

title: Superx++
desc: - Compiled object-oriented language fully based on XML syntax; conforms to XML version 1.0 specification as published by W3C. Descriptions, documents, FAQ, downloads, links. [Open Source, LGPL]

title: UnrealScript Language Reference
desc: - High level, simple, Java-style, object-oriented, compile time error checking; native support for major concepts of time, state, properties, networking, which few languages address, to greatly simplify code. Mainly for games.

title: Reddit: Programming
desc: - For discussion and news about computer programming. Stories with user comments.

title: Wikipedia - Computer Programming
desc: - Cover its history, provides an overview, describes modern programming and common procedures and problems, programming languages and programmers.
